sentences.en: Banks are built to look solid to reassure their customers.
sentences.cn: 银行往往建得看上去很坚固，好让顾客放心。

sentences.en: Both sides have agreed to demobilize 70% of their armies.
sentences.cn: 双方都同意各自遣散70%的军队。

sentences.en: Faculty members complain that their students are unprepared to do college-level work.
sentences.cn: 学院的老师们抱怨说他们的学生还很不适应大学的课业。

sentences.en: He manoeuvred the enemy out of their position.
sentences.cn: 他用计谋使敌人离开他们的阵地。

sentences.en: He was waving his arms to draw their attention.
sentences.cn: 他正挥手以引起他们的注意。

sentences.en: He would not knuckle down under their pressure.
sentences.cn: 他不会在他们的压力下屈服的。

sentences.en: Husband and wife are now taxed separately on their incomes.
sentences.cn: 现在夫妻双方分别按各自的收入纳税。

sentences.en: In America, they go out with their friends.
sentences.cn: 在美国，他们与他们的朋友出去。

sentences.en: It's a long way to go for two people in their seventies.
sentences.cn: 对于两个七十几岁的人来说，这段路太远了。

sentences.en: Monks shave their heads, as do devotees of the Hare Krishna movement.
sentences.cn: 和尚要剃度，克利须那派教徒也一样。

sentences.en: My pulses, her pulses, their pulses.
sentences.cn: 我的脉搏，她的脉搏，他们的脉搏。

sentences.en: People had moved back into their own homes.
sentences.cn: 人们搬回了自己的家中。

sentences.en: Politicians want a lap-dog press which will uncritically report their propaganda.
sentences.cn: 政客们想要的是不问是非、甘为他们搞宣传的哈巴狗一样的新闻媒体。

sentences.en: Substantial numbers of rank and file members ignored their union's advice.
sentences.cn: 有相当一部分普通员工不理睬工会的建议。

sentences.en: The brothers usually roll into their studio around midday.
sentences.cn: 兄弟几个总是要到正午前后才姗姗来到工作室。

sentences.en: The twins spend all their time together.
sentences.cn: 这对双胞胎总是待在一起。

sentences.en: The waiter returned with their order and Graham signed the bill.
sentences.cn: 侍者把他们点的餐端了过来，格雷厄姆签了单。

sentences.en: Their ears were still attuned to the sounds of the London suburb.
sentences.cn: 他们依然很熟悉伦敦市郊的喧闹声。

sentences.en: Their replies were no more than grunts of acknowledgement.
sentences.cn: 他们所谓的回答不过是表示承认的咕哝罢了。

sentences.en: They have maintained their optimism in the face of desolating subjugation.
sentences.cn: 面对遭征服的悲惨命运，他们保持了乐观的态度。

sentences.en: They have their compensations.
sentences.cn: 他们有他们的报酬。

sentences.en: They talked her round to their position.
sentences.cn: 他们说服她同意他们的看法。

sentences.en: They washed their faces and went to bed.
sentences.cn: 他们洗过脸后上床睡觉去了。

sentences.en: Victorian houses can seem cold with their lofty ceilings and rambling rooms.
sentences.cn: 维多利亚式房屋屋顶高耸，房间布局凌乱，因此可能会显得较为阴冷。

trans.tran_cn: 他们的；她们的；它们的，（在提及性别不详的人时，用以代替his或her）

trans.tran_en: used when talking about someone who may be male or female, to avoid saying ‘his or her’
belonging to or connected with people or things that have already been mentioned
indicate that something belongs or relates to the group of people, animals, or things that you are talking about
